content.text:
Here is my response formatted as requested:

<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Preparing Affidavits and Legal Documents

1. Affidavit Preparation
   - Gather relevant facts and information from client or attorney
   - Draft affidavit using proper legal language and format
   - Include required elements: title, statement of identity, oath, facts, signature
   - Review draft with attorney and make any necessary revisions
   - Arrange for notarization of final affidavit

2. Legal Correspondence
   - Compose letters, emails, and other communications as directed
   - Use appropriate legal terminology and formal language
   - Proofread all correspondence for accuracy and clarity
   - Obtain attorney approval before sending

3. Document Organization
   - Create logical filing system for both paper and electronic documents
   - Develop consistent naming conventions for electronic files
   - Scan paper documents and save electronic versions when appropriate
   - Implement version control for documents with multiple drafts

4. File Maintenance
   - Regularly update and organize both paper and electronic files
   - Ensure all documents are properly labeled and easy to locate
   - Securely store confidential information
   - Archive or dispose of outdated documents according to firm policy

5. Document Management Software
   - Utilize legal-specific document management software
   - Input and categorize documents in the system
   - Apply appropriate tags and metadata for easy searching
   - Train other staff on proper use of the document management system

</OUTPUT_TEXT>
